intro: Styphelia laeta var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous habitats. Its smooth, glabrous stems and pale pink or white flowers make it a distinctive and attractive species. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
